body_html:
So I'm looking at getting clamp fused, but the output type of clamp is identified as Unknown and so shouldFuse is false. I'm not quite sure where it happens: tt will not evaluate to true for clamp but will for relu in the below, but the output is defined somewhere entirely else that I haven't found yet.

pytorch/torch/csrc/jit/passes/graph_fuser.cpp

Line 152 in 24eb5ad

if(auto tt = node->output()->type()->cast<TensorType>()) {

One thing I have wondered is whether the constants passed to clamp (which is declared without named-only parameters "*") cause the problem here.

So I found it in shape analysis. Thanks @ngimel . Now I have to check on the backward pass.

body:
So I'm looking at getting clamp fused, but the output type of clamp is identified as Unknown and so shouldFuse is false. I'm not quite sure where it happens: tt will not evaluate to true for clamp but will for relu in the below, but the output is defined somewhere entirely else that I haven't found yet.

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/24eb5ad0c5388bd98f3f0ee3296ab4ad2c13bdd4/torch/csrc/jit/passes/graph_fuser.cpp#L152

One thing I have wondered is whether the constants passed to clamp (which is declared without named-only parameters "*") cause the problem here.

So I found it in shape analysis. Thanks @ngimel . Now I have to check on the backward pass.
